intro: Solanum delagoense var. astrochlaenoides, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree with smooth, often hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, clustered in umbels, and the fruit is a globose berry that turns red when mature. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its toxic properties, containing alkaloids such as solasodine. This plant is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, growing in well-drained soils.
